intro: Lunathyrium sichuanense var. gongshanense, commonly known as the Gongshan moonflower, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Yunnan Province in China. It belongs to the familyApiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments at high altitudes, often in forest understories. Its flowers, which bloom in late summer, are white to pale pink and emit a subtle fragrance. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
